propDescriptions.classes: Override or extend the styles applied to the component. See CSS API below for more details.
propDescriptions.component: The component used for the root node. Either a string to use a HTML element or a component.
propDescriptions.flexItem: If true, a vertical divider will have the correct height when used in flex container. (By default, a vertical divider will have a calculated height of 0px if it is the child of a flex container.)
propDescriptions.light: If true, the divider will have a lighter color.

root.description: Styles applied to the root element.

absolute.description: Styles applied to the root element if {{conditions}}.

inset.description: Styles applied to the root element if {{conditions}}.

fullWidth.description: Styles applied to the root element if {{conditions}}.

light.description: Styles applied to the root element if {{conditions}}.

middle.description: Styles applied to the root element if {{conditions}}.

vertical.description: Styles applied to the root element if {{conditions}}.

flexItem.description: Styles applied to the root element if {{conditions}}.

withChildren.description: Styles applied to the root element if divider have text.

withChildrenVertical.description: Styles applied to the root element if divider have text and `orientation="vertical"`.

textAlignRight.description: Styles applied to the root element if {{conditions}}.

textAlignLeft.description: Styles applied to the root element if {{conditions}}.

wrapper.description: Styles applied to the span children element if {{conditions}}.

wrapperVertical.description: Styles applied to the span children element if {{conditions}}.
